intro: Anoplon biebersteinii, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Anoplon biebersteinii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
